ygData.messageBody:
Ya, i've found little use for skill points. The best thing i ever used
them for was feign death, but I think it would have been a better choice
to just sit somewhere for 3 hours and get it up.

Disarm i just got, and found that it can be raised quite easily by
giving a weapon to your nearest level 1 monster and then take it back,
feign, get up, then hand it right back, and repeat.

Probably the best use there could be is the trade skills, as someone
else mentioned.



> From: Jacob Jensen <jacob@...>
>
> > I am a level 7 monk and i have 20 points to spend. Would you
> recommend i spend them on offensive skills now, save them for later,
> use them on a skill to make money, or use them on throwing. If on
> > throwing is it a really good skill to get, does it do any damage or
> is it just to attract animals as ive heard. Thanks for your time.
>
> > -Krazer, Level 7 Monk, Tunare
>
> No matter what, dont use them on offensive skills. Your skills will
> max out at each level as you use them. Waste of points. I've found
> Throwing to be a useless skill as well, only using it rarely to lure.
>
> If I were you, I'd save them for Feign Death at level 17.
>
> Anyone but me that feels skill points are pretty useless for monks?
> Hehe, I mean, after you get feign death, how many skills are left? 4?
> 5? And most, if not all, monk skills are used in combat constantly, so
> they'll max out by themselfs.
>
> *shrug* Might just be me...
>
> --Jake
> Aka Laintal Novacek, level 24 monk, Povar.
>
